Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Necklace
Description: Necklace found around the neck of a child. Composed of oval beads of a grey-green siliceous conglomerate alternating with groups of one, two or three disc-shaped beads of ostrich eggshell. A tubular bead of enamel, the colour varying from turquoise to yellow, is the central piece. The neritic shell was found near the right arm of the deceased and is placed here as a pendant.
